articles.title: The turnover of the Bulgarian Stock Exchange has increased by 184% after the adoption of the euro in Bulgaria
articles.summary: Bulgaria officially became the 21st member of the euro area on 1 January 2026 – 19 years after its accession to the EU
articles.content:
Bulgaria officially became the 21st member of the euro area on 1 January 2026 – 19 years after its accession to the EU

SOFIA – The turnover of the Bulgarian Stock Exchange (BSE) increased by 184% in the first week of trading after Bulgaria’s accession to the euro area, the exchange reported. At the same time, transactions on the BSE recorded a 112.79 percent year-on-year increase. As a result of the high activity, the oldest BSE index, SOFIX, achieved a rise of 14.41 percent to 1323.06 points in the first week of trading after the adoption of the euro.

The BSE notes that a similar parallel in terms of increased trading can be drawn with another key historical moment in the country’s history – Bulgaria’s accession to the European Union (EU). Data from the beginning of 2007 show that in the first week after Bulgaria’s accession to the EU, SOFIX rose by 6.37 percent – from 1224.12 to 1302.81 points.

“Accession to the euro area places Bulgaria in a new position on the financial map of Europe. The market reaction even on the very first trading day is indicative – SOFIX rose by 3.7 percent in a single day, and in the following days it continued at a similar pace. This is a clear indicator of long-term confidence building, better market infrastructure and higher financial awareness,” said Assoc. Prof. Dr. Manyu Moravenov, Executive Director of the BSE, quoted by the exchange’s press office.

The upward trend in turnover and the main index continues in the first days of the second week of trading in euro. The cycle of high growth achieved by Bulgarian public companies in recent years will continue for at least the next 2 years, Moravenov predicted during the official ceremony for the launch of trading on the BSE in euro on 5 January 2026

Bulgaria officially became the 21st member of the euro area on 1 January 2026 – 19 years after the country’s accession to the EU. (13.01.2026)

articles.personality_title: Bulgaria’s stock market surges after joining the euro area
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context** – Bulgaria joined the euro area on January 1, 2026, becoming the 21st country to use the euro as its currency. This happened 19 years after Bulgaria became a member of the European Union.

**What happened** – In the first week after adopting the euro, the Bulgarian Stock Exchange (BSE) saw its trading turnover increase by 184%. The number of transactions also rose by about 113% compared to the same time last year. The main stock index, called SOFIX, went up by over 14% during that week.

**Impact** – This sharp rise in trading and stock values shows that investors feel more confident about Bulgaria’s economy now that it uses the euro. The increase is even bigger than what happened when Bulgaria joined the EU in 2007. Experts say this reflects better financial systems and stronger trust in the market.

**What's next step** – Experts expect this positive trend to continue for at least two more years. Bulgarian companies are likely to keep growing as the country benefits from being part of the euro area.

**One-sentence takeaway** – Joining the euro area has quickly boosted Bulgaria’s stock market, signaling increased investor confidence and economic growth ahead.
articles.personality_title_fr: La Bourse bulgare en forte hausse après l’adoption de l’euro
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte** – La Bulgarie est devenue membre de la zone euro le 1er janvier 2026, devenant ainsi le 21e pays à utiliser l’euro comme monnaie. Cela intervient 19 ans après son entrée dans l’Union européenne.

**Ce qui s’est passé** – Lors de la première semaine après l’adoption de l’euro, le volume des échanges à la Bourse de Bulgarie a augmenté de 184%. Le nombre de transactions a également progressé d’environ 113% par rapport à la même période l’année précédente. L’indice principal, SOFIX, a gagné plus de 14% durant cette semaine.

**Impact** – Cette forte hausse montre que les investisseurs ont plus confiance dans l’économie bulgare maintenant que le pays utilise l’euro. Cette augmentation est même plus importante que celle observée lors de l’adhésion de la Bulgarie à l’UE en 2007. Les experts expliquent cela par une meilleure infrastructure financière et une confiance accrue dans le marché.

**Prochaine étape** – Les experts prévoient que cette tendance positive se poursuivra au moins pendant deux ans. Les entreprises bulgares devraient continuer à croître grâce aux avantages liés à la zone euro.

**Résumé en une phrase** – L’entrée dans la zone euro a rapidement stimulé la Bourse bulgare, signe d’une confiance accrue des investisseurs et d’une croissance économique à venir.
articles.personality_title_es: La bolsa búlgara se dispara tras unirse a la zona euro
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto** – Bulgaria se unió a la zona euro el 1 de enero de 2026, convirtiéndose en el país número 21 en usar el euro como moneda. Esto ocurrió 19 años después de que Bulgaria entrara en la Unión Europea.

**Qué pasó** – En la primera semana tras adoptar el euro, la Bolsa de Valores de Bulgaria (BSE) vio un aumento del 184% en el volumen de operaciones. El número de transacciones también subió alrededor del 113% en comparación con el mismo período del año anterior. El índice principal, SOFIX, subió más del 14% esa semana.

**Impacto** – Esta fuerte subida indica que los inversores tienen más confianza en la economía búlgara ahora que usa el euro. El aumento es incluso mayor que el que ocurrió cuando Bulgaria entró en la UE en 2007. Los expertos dicen que esto refleja una mejor infraestructura financiera y mayor confianza en el mercado.

**Próximo paso** – Los expertos esperan que esta tendencia positiva continúe al menos dos años más. Se espera que las empresas búlgaras sigan creciendo gracias a los beneficios de pertenecer a la zona euro.

**Conclusión en una frase** – La adhesión a la zona euro ha impulsado rápidamente la bolsa búlgara, mostrando mayor confianza de los inversores y crecimiento económico futuro.
